title: Bricklayer Estimation - Fuck the Exact Count, Start Building
summary: You don't count every brick before building a house. Know the rough magnitude, order enough pallets, start laying. Over-planning is procrastination in a suit.

the_method.step_2: Enough resources to start - not to finish

bricklayer.question: How many bricks in this house?

analyst.question: How many bricks in this house?
analyst.answer: Let me create a spreadsheet, model the variables, account for breakage rates...

when_to_use: any situation where perfect info is impossible

examples.doors: About 6000 doors in a year, about 300 books worth - close enough, start making doors
examples.startup: About 6 months runway, about 1000 users needed - close enough, start building
examples.code: About 5 files to change, about 200 lines - close enough, start coding

antipatterns: calculating exact brick count before laying first brick
wisdom: Over-planning is procrastination in a suit
The bricks don't lay themselves while you're doing arithmetic
Direction right + magnitude right = details sort themselves
About 300, now shut up and make the next door
Rough and moving beats precise and stationary
